subject: Re: [junit] Using real data or test data?

messageBody:
I lean towards robust test data, and figure that my personal manual testing, and the testing from QC will handle the 'real data' scenario. I agree that test data allows complete control over the content - the challenge being to make sure that it is realistic.

-------------- Original message --------------

We test various ERP programs, like purchasing demand calculation
(complex business logic).

I think it is a better approach to use test data which cover the
various use cases or boundaries instead of real data. With "test data"
I mean data which I create in my test program and which I persist in
the database. After the test finished, I delete the test data (with an
EntityGarbageCollector).

But our new project leader thinks we should use only real data ("one
dataset for all tests"). I don't think that this would work. We need
both strategies I think, even if one solution seems to be redundant.

To only use real test data has big disadvantages in my opinion:
- if data changes (real data does), then tests break
- you need much more real data than test data to cover all the
boundaries and use cases
- if you add real data or remove real data from the dataset, tests
might break

What do you think about it?
